DOC.brief_summary: We evaluated the effects of giving a single dose of steroid before thyroid surgery in a single institutional, double-blinded, randomized controlled trial. Postoperative nausea, pain, and vocal function were significantly improved after steroid administration compared to controls.
DOC.criteria: Patients undergoing thyroid surgery for benign disease Depression Chronic pain disorder Insulin dependent diabetes mellitus History of PONV Pregnancy Age < 18 years Received antiemetic therapy within 48 hours
